intro: Cerastium raciborskii, commonly known as the rock chickweed, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant features hairy, succulent stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is typically found in alpine or subalpine regions. Cerastium raciborskii is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient member of its ecosystem.
